THE PUBLIC RADIO STUDY
College Study Director
Vincent M. Badger
1384 Massachusetts Avenue
Cambridge, Massachusetts 02138
(617) 864-0219
April 10, 1969
Dear Sir:
The Ford Foundation and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting are
jointly sponsoring a study of college and university radio stations in the United
States. This project has grown out of a recently completed investigation of
noncommercial radio broadcasting by the Public Radio Study.
As you know, both the Corporation and the Foundation have a vital inter¬
est in the role of broadcasting in American life. Two aspects of college and
university stations are of special interest in this study: their growing impor¬
tance as influential voices to their audiences, and their status as training
grounds for future leaders in broadcasting.
The attached questionnaire is the most important part of this study. We
understand how staff and time problems can make answering questionnaires an
unwelcome task to most stations. We have therefore tried to design this ques¬
tionnaire to require as little time as possible. Its apparent length is deceiving:
most questions are multiple choice. The questionnaire should not take more
than half an hour or so to complete.
Your assistance is crucial to the success of the study. A good return will
give the Corporation and the Foundation invaluable direction in funding and
initiating projects, and in dealing with grant requests in this area. Both organi¬
zations are interested in defining a positive role for themselves in relation to
college and university stations, but this cannot be done without your help.
If, in answering the questionnaire, you feel that any point requires more
discussion than is possible in your response, please indicate this fact. We
will make every effort to contact you, either in person or by phone.
Thank you for your contribution to this important effort.
Sincerely,
Vincent M. Badger
An independent study under grants from
The Corporation for Public Broadcasting and The Ford Foundation
